wikipedia_page.main: Professor Azim Nanji is a Kenyan-born professor of Islamic studies. From 1998 until 2008, he served as Director of The Institute of Ismaili Studies in London, England. At present, he is the Senior Associate Director of the Abbasi Program in Islamic Studies at Stanford University. He is also on the Board of Directors of the Global Centre for Pluralism a joint partnership between His Highness the Aga Khan and the Government of Canada.

response: * A Historical Atlas of the Islamic World (with Azim Nanji; OUP/Harvard University Press, 2004; won the 2005 US Middle East Outreach Council Book Award)
